item.title: Issue #473 created
item.description:
NaN ne NaN

It seems that ever since 2.0, the section in Functions and Operators "Comparison Operators on Numeric Values" (currently ยง4.3) has stated "If either, or both, operands are NaN, false is returned."

This is incorrect. If the operator is ne, then the correct result is true.

(And editorially, the first two commas in this sentence should be dropped).
